individualId.description: The individual id - UIN or VID.

otpChannels.description: Otp channels using which user will be notified, for example - EMAIL, PHONE

transactionId.description: The transaction id of the request

post.description:
This api is used to generate otp for wallet binding.
This api is used as a proxy to call [Identity Provider - Send Binding OTP Endpoint](https://mosip.stoplight.io/docs/identity-provider/mk9xsyt7rvnez-send-binding-otp-endpoint) api internally.

authFactorType.description: Auth factor type to be binded for the provided key.

format.description: Format of the auth factor type supported in the wallet app. Right now Inji supports only jwt.

individualId.description: The individual id. UIN or VID.

publicKey.description: The public key of the wallet app.

authFactorType.description: Defines the type of auth challenge. It should be same as authfactor.type (oauth-details response).

certificate.description: Server certificate after successful binding. This certificate will be stored in wallet app.

encryptedWalletBindingId.description: the wallet binding id in encrypted format. The wallet app will associate the requested credential with this id.

expireDateTime.description: expiry date time of the binding.

post.description:
This api is used to bind the credential   with wallet.
This api is used as a proxy to call [Identity Provider - Wallet binding Endpoint](https://mosip.stoplight.io/docs/identity-provider/j4rvet323vah4-wallet-binding-endpoint) api internally.

display.description: The issuer details that is displayed to the user

.well-known.description: The well-known endpoint of the client

get.summary: Get the list of existing issuers
get.description: This api is used to get the list of issuers who issue credential to Inji

redirect_uri.description: The redirection uri, in our case Inji

authorization_endpoint.description: The url where the authorization is performed

token_endpoint.description: The url which issues the token for the given code

credential_endpoint.description: The url to download the credential

grant_type.description: specifies which OAuth 2.0 grant types client will use.
